content:
What have I been up to? After a lot of hard work, I’ve finished this semester. Instead of just sitting around, I decided to take the rest of the time I have left before I get back to studying to work on my Linkedin profile and Github contributions, since there isn’t enough time for me to look for a internship.
Things to look forward to Last semester, I tried for the first time to study using only digital notes, and it worked out really great. Now that I have finnaly got the new iPad Mini that I wanted for a long time, I can start reading more news and studying more efficiently, which will make it easier for me to make more posts like these.
Curated selection Intresting articles Facebook loses users for first time ever, market cap drops by $200 billion Meta’s earnings call revealed bad news buried within bad news. The market did not react kindly to the news. Meta’s stock has taken a massive hit and is currently trading down around 24 percent below yesterday’s close, wiping around $200 billion off its market cap.
https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2022/02/facebook-loses-users-for-first-time-ever-market-cap-drops-by-200b/
Article photo
In the Joe Rogan debate, Spotify is acting like a spectator rather than a player In many ways, what Spotify is grappling with right now is the same thing social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter have had to confront over the last five years. They’re so big that they need to have guidelines around what people post, and accept some degree of responsibility for how they disseminate information. Spotify needs to do the same thing, with the added wrinkle that there’s no gray area: By paying artists and podcasters to appear on its platform, the company has a responsibility for the content it puts out. Of course, it’s not clear Spotify sees it that way.
https://www.engadget.com/spotify-joe-rogan-publisher-or-platform-184538877.html
Inspiring videos How a CS student tracks Elon’s Private Jet with Python // The Code Report
summary:
What have I been up to? After a lot of hard work, I’ve finished this semester. Instead of just sitting around, I decided to take the rest of the time I have left before I get back to studying to work on my Linkedin profile and Github contributions, since there isn’t enough time for me to look for a internship.
Things to look forward to Last semester, I tried for the first time to study using only digital notes, and it worked out really great.
title: Weekly Rundown 4

content:
Curated selection Intresting articles Snap is finally profitable Snapchat has more users than ever. Nearly five years after going public, Snap is finally profitable. The company shared the milestone in its fourth-quarter earnings release, where it reported $23 million in positive net income.
https://www.engadget.com/snap-q4-2021-earnings-230605242.html Why gamers hate crypto, and music fans don’t The very different reactions that two different types of fandoms are having to blockchain-based products — and whether that tells us anything about what average people might actually want out of crypto.
https://www.theverge.com/22917126/nfts-crypto-gamers-music-fans-fandoms
Inspiring videos Build my startup with me Follow Jedcal as he builds his website called ratemydorm.com, based on the popular, already established ratemyprofessor.com. The app allows students to leave reviews for their dorms, so that other students know wich ones to pick. In the video, Jedcal shows his whole process for coming up with ideas for features, aswell as plans on nhow to monetize his app.
Free Book Github(.asciidoc): https://github.com/ethereumbook/ethereumbook
PDF: https://dl.ebooksworld.ir/motoman/Mastering_Ethereum_Andreas.M.Antonopoulos.www.EBooksWorld.ir.pdf

title: Weekly Rundown 3 (30 January_5 February)

content:
What have I been up to? This past month has been a lot of work. Having done tests on all my different classes and also many different team projects, I can say that November has been tough. Despite all I said, I think that this year has been the least stressful of my 3-year journey at university. I think I have adapted quite well to this lifestyle, and if I keep my pace, I think I’ll do fine.
Things to look forward to I dont have any planned personal projects, since I have so much work with my university already. Maybe I’ll play around with a new technology during the xmas holidays and learn something.
Curated selection Inspiring videos Can GitHub Copilot center a div?
A honest overview of the new and revolutionary technology created by Github to help programmers code using AI.
I Put the Dislike Count BACK on my Channel
“I’m not a fan of YouTube removing the dislike count from all videos, so I decided to put the discount like back on my own channel with a little bit of code”
summary: What have I been up to? This past month has been a lot of work. Having done tests on all my different classes and also many different team projects, I can say that November has been tough. Despite all I said, I think that this year has been the least stressful of my 3-year journey at university. I think I have adapted quite well to this lifestyle, and if I keep my pace, I think I’ll do fine.
title: Weekly Rundown 2 (21 November_27 November)

content:
What have I been up to? I decided to start this new project where I write about all the cool stuff that happened each week. I will try to post one of these everyweek, starting now (last week of October 2021).
To help achieve this, I created a python script that automaticly create a post with some template text.
import datetime import calendar import os def getSundayDate(weekday, date): switcher = { "Monday": 1, "Tuesday": 2, "Wednesday": 3, "Thursday": 4, "Friday": 5, "Saturday": 6, "Sunday": 0 } difference = switcher.get(weekday, -1) d = datetime.timedelta(days = difference) sunday = date-d return sunday def getCurrentDates(): my_date = datetime.date.today() day_of_week = calendar.day_name[my_date.weekday()] sunday = getSundayDate(day_of_week,my_date) sixdays = datetime.timedelta(days = 6) saturday = sunday + sixdays month1 = calendar.month_name[sunday.month] month2 = calendar.month_name[saturday.month] firstday = str(sunday.day) + " " + month1 lastday = str(saturday.day) + " " + month2 return firstday, lastday def countWeeklys(): os.chdir(postdir) files_or_folders = [name for name in os.listdir(".") if os.path.isdir(name)] count = 0 for file in files_or_folders: fWord = file.split()[0] if (fWord=="Weekly"): count+=1 return count def getTemplate(): template = open("template.txt", 'r') return template.readlines() if __name__ == '__main__': number = countWeeklys() + 1 name = input("What will be this weeks rundown name: ") firstday, lastday = getCurrentDates() title = "\"Weekly Rundown " + str(number)+ " (" + firstday+ "_" + lastday + ") " + name + "\"" command = "cd /Users/myuser/blog/myblog \n hugo new posts/{}/index.md".format(title) os.system(command) filename = "/Users/myuser/blog/myblog/content/posts/{}/index.md".format(title[1:(len(title)-1)]) with open(filename, 'r') as f: text = f.readlines() template = getTemplate() with open(filename, 'w') as f: for line in text: f.write(line) for line in template: f.write(line) Here is how my template.txt looks like:
# What have I been up to? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit... # Things to look forward to Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit... # Curated selection ## Intresting articles Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit... ## Inspiring videos Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit... ## Cool websites Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit... I might change the template in the future to incorporate more types of content that I find relevant. I would also like to add a youtuber of the week shoutout, because there are may content creators that I follow who could help other people improve their skills and workflow, as they did for me.
Things to look forward to This section will be for writing down expectations for the week after or talking about projects that I’m working on at the moment. Hopefully, I will have something to write about here in the following weeks.
Curated selection Intresting articles When it comes to solar farms, sheep are great groundskeepers USDA funds project to build new group in support of solar grazing. https://arstechnica.com/science/2021/10/shepherds-can-cash-in-on-their-sheep-grazing-around-solar-panels/
Bounty hunter Spike Spiegel is back on the hunt in Cowboy Bebop trailer “If the cops and the bounty hunters don’t get you, the Syndicate will.” https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2021/10/a-trio-of-space-cowboys-saddle-up-for-adventure-in-official-cowboy-bebop-trailer/
Inspiring videos Joma Tech - 10 years of coding in 13 minutes
Joma Tech is a really funny youtuber that makes content about tech and programming. In this video, he talks about all the different classes he took and internships he did during his college years, aswell as some of his past work experiences. Joma also reveals the biggest takeaways that he got from each year of his 10 year journey as a programmer.
Jamie Siminoff Was Rejected From Shark Tank And Then Became One Heres How
Short video about the creator of the Ring doorbell, that was sold to Amazon.
Cool websites Best websites a programmer should visit
Part of the Awesome project, this is a list of websites with different functionalties and use cases. The index makes it super easy to navigate and find new websites to explore. It is also where I found the next entry.
ars technica
Posts unique quality articles. Really recommend.
summary:
What have I been up to? I decided to start this new project where I write about all the cool stuff that happened each week. I will try to post one of these everyweek, starting now (last week of October 2021).
To help achieve this, I created a python script that automaticly create a post with some template text.
import datetime import calendar import os def getSundayDate(weekday, date): switcher = { "Monday": 1, "Tuesday": 2, "Wednesday": 3, "Thursday": 4, "Friday": 5, "Saturday": 6, "Sunday": 0 } difference = switcher.
title: Weekly Rundown 1 (24 October_30 October)
